item.title: about me
item.description:
üë§foto.jpg
Giacomo Fantato
// Data Scientist ¬∑ European Central Bank
üìç Frankfurt am Main, Germany giacomofantato@outlook.it github linkedin
bio

I'm a Data Scientist with a strong background in data analytics, computer science, and quantitative methods for finance. I hold a degree in Computer Science for Management from the University of Bologna and completed advanced programs in Data Science, Business Analytics, and Quantitative Finance at the University of Warsaw.

Currently, I work as a Data Scientist Trainee at the European Central Bank, supporting statistical analyses and data-driven decision-making. I‚Äôm passionate about tackling new challenges and continuously growing my skills.

curriculum vitae
‚Üì Download PDF
experience
Data Scientist
02/2026 ‚Äî Present
European Central Bank (ECB) ¬∑ Frankfurt am Main, Germany
Data Scientist Trainee within the Directorate General Statistics (DGS), part of the CASPAR team. Use Python and main data science and visualization libraries to provide meaningful insights. Apply DevOps and DevSecOps paradigms from development to deployment.
ICT Strategy Consultant
07/2025 ‚Äî 01/2026
KPMG Italy ¬∑ Verona, Italy
Member of the CIO Advisory team at Nolan, Norton Italia, supporting organizations in defining IT strategies, digital transformation programs, ICT investment optimization, and SOX compliance. Activities include technology and data strategy design, ICT planning, governance models, vendor management, cybersecurity, and compliance. Also involved in PMO activities for complex technology and organizational projects.
Business Intelligence Analyst
01/2023 ‚Äî 03/2023
Aggity Italy ¬∑ Bologna, Italy
Creation of dashboards and reports in Power BI for manufacturing companies (Industry 4.0). Use of PowerQuery and SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) for data mining on I4.0 manufacturing databases derived from OperaMES. Applied software engineering paradigms from development to final cloud deployment.
SEO Specialist
06/2018 ‚Äî 07/2018
Gold Future Trends Ltd. ¬∑ Vilnius, Lithuania
Creation of multimedia and graphic content (flyers, business cards) using Adobe Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, Premiere Pro). Management and optimization of WordPress CMS for manufacturing and service sector companies using Google SEO. Creation and management of advertising campaigns through Google Ads.
HPC User Support
03/2018 ‚Äî 04/2018
CINECA ¬∑ Bologna, Italy
Development of a scheduler in Python (using Slurm and Courses library) for active jobs on the Marconi HPC cluster. Learned task management logics on Unix HPC architecture (CentOS). Applied DevSecOps practices for development and deployment of the software product.

Courses included: Machine Learning, Time Series Analysis, Risk Analysis and Modeling, International Finance, Financial Econometrics, Asset Allocation and Investment Strategies, Applied Macroeconomics with Python and GAMS.

item.title: projects
item.description:
projects
Master's Thesis ‚Äî ML for Credit Card Fraud Detection
‚Üó github ‚Üó RAPIDS on GCP
Universit√† degli Studi di Verona ¬∑ lug 2025 ‚Äì set 2025
Under Basel III, banks must maintain the intraday liquidity ratio, which can be disrupted by credit card fraud. My thesis focused on designing and evaluating ML-based fraud detection systems. Comparative assessment of Decision Tree, Random Forest, XGBoost, LightGBM, CatBoost and TabNet. Workflow accelerated with NVIDIA RAPIDS on Google Cloud Platform with H100 GPUs.
Python XGBoost LightGBM NVIDIA RAPIDS GCP Grade: 8/8
Financial Volatility Modeling with GARCH and DCC-GARCH
‚Üó github
Uniwersytet Warszawski ¬∑ mag 2025 ‚Äì giu 2025
Comprehensive volatility analysis of global equity markets (S&P 500, NASDAQ 100, DAX, Nikkei 225) using univariate GARCH(1,1) and multivariate DCC-GARCH(1,1). Included stationarity testing, dynamic correlation modeling, in-sample and out-of-sample VaR evaluation and portfolio-level risk assessment.
R GARCH DCC-GARCH VaR Grade: 5!/5
Value-at-Risk Estimation using Multivariate GARCH-family Models
‚Üó github
Uniwersytet Warszawski ¬∑ mag 2025 ‚Äì giu 2025
VaR estimation of a diversified portfolio (Boeing, S&P 500, Gold, USD/PLN, Ethereum) using GARCH and EGARCH models. Automated pipeline for volatility modeling, best-fitting specification selected via AIC, Ljung-Box and LM-ARCH tests. Rolling VaR forecasts aligned to NYSE trading calendar.
R EGARCH VaR Time Series Grade: 30/30
ML Project: Apartment Price Prediction & Insurance Claim Classification
‚Üó github
Uniwersytet Warszawski ¬∑ apr 2025 ‚Äì mag 2025
Applied ML to two datasets: apartment price prediction (156k training records) and insurance claim classification (57k observations). Full pipeline including EDA, feature engineering, encoding, scaling, cross-validation and hyperparameter tuning across multiple algorithms.
Python Scikit-learn Regression Classification Grade: 5!/5
